comment:
Biere industrielle vendue par pack de 1000....elle ne m'a vraiment pas convaincu.
Pas de goûts, lourde ...

Découverte au bar du transbordeur avec mon che Appiantiqua.
Le nez nous amène rapidement sur les houblons et malts avec une toute petite note florale qui lui donne ce côté rafraîchissant et très léger.
Une bière d'avant concert agréable à boire!10/20

i'm trying to forget... I'm trying to forget... I'm trying to forget.
Taste is sweet and a tad bitter. Very Metallic...

Dégustée au bar du transbordeur avec mon petit Kittenbieer.
Température de début 6° environ.
Nez léger sur le houblon et malts.
Le goût est sans relief particulier et typique des pale lager.
Le palais est du même ordre.
C'est quelconque mais rafraîchissant et se laisse boire.
10/20

Tap @ Poco Loco Burger, Chamonix accompanying the biggest burger I've ever had in my life. Pours clear gold, lightly sweet pale lager malt aroma. Taste is clean, simple lager with a soft sweetness that lends well to a light drinkability, if a little light-bodied.
Idéale pour une terrasse de café sans bières dignes de ce nom. Pour moi, supérieure à la Heineken. Rafraîchissante. Parfaite avec du Picon !

Appearance: Pours clear pale gold with a white head, with a little lacing.
3/5

Aroma: Malts and grain, a little fruity.
4/10

Taste: Malts, a little lemon, watery, not a lot on the palate. A light bitterness into the finish.
2/10

Mouthfeel: Very light bodied, very low carbonated.
3/5

Overall
4/20

Rated 171213. Can from Carrefour, Saumur. Bought in the summer and now found well hidden in our fridge. 
Clear golden amber body, white head. Sweet malty nose and likewise palate with a distinct banana flavour. Typical industrial lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gggghhjhhjjhhjnnjnnmjnnnnvccggghhhgfghjjjjgcfdefgt bggiugftygfdggdchcgghvbbcvcgjhhhh

---Ra via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had from can . Pale golden colour. Thin dissipating head. Tinny / metallic taste
Nic specjalnego. Typowy koncernowy średniak. Aromat słaby, wygląd średni, smak kiepski.
Güzel koku, az asitlik. İçerken alkolün tadı alınabiliyor. Kesinlikle soğuk içilmeli.
Ljusare gul öl med ganska snabbt försvinnande vitt skum. Smak och doft av malt, hö och majssötma. En industrilager i mängden.

Pours gold with a frothy white head. Strong malty sweet aroma with light nail polish hints. Taste is mildly sweet, a bit grainy, nondescript. Body is watery and the 5.5 abv is poorly hidden. Drab stuff.
Aroma of malt. Pale golden in the glass with frothy head. Taste is semi sweet with notes of maltiness, not even hoppy. Only refreshing, but will be better if you try some water than this beer.

From Jun 2007

Purchased at Liquor Shed in Casper.

Pours from 12oz cap wrapped with label bottle a medium gold with a good head of foam that shrinks quickly to a fine broken layer and it has some lacing.

The smell is on the hoppy side but I can just detect some malt character there as well.

The taste also has a good hoppy taste up front, mostly in the form of of lemon citrus, but that's taken over by an earthy malt flavour. After a few more sips, the flavours seem to let up and it tends to lean on the watery side but it still isn't bad. Quite refreshing so I won't have any trouble finishing the 6 pack over the next few days.
Kinda suprising, not a strong, but very fresh. Good choice when you are thirsty.

Piwo złociste, klarowne z średnią białą pianą.
W aromacie słodowe, trochę chmielu.
W smaku to samo z niską goryczką.
Pint at shit pub. Pale gold with a residing head thin. Scent is scentless. Taste is weird metallic, dry, crisp properties. Finish consistent and apple. Fine.
De betere variant van Kronenbourg, maar ze komen van eindeloos ver, dus nog steeds gebuisd. Te commercieel.

330ml bottle from Publix. France's entry in the Int'l Pale Lager market? Pours clear yellow with a thin white head. Muted flavors of cereal, caramel, light hops. Body is fairly thin, with a slightly metallic finish. Keep it cold, it'll be fine.

Clear golden color with medium white head.
Aroma: malt, hop
Taste: light sweet
Obfita piana, złote idealnie klarowne. Aromat średni czuć piwo, jakiś słód, chmiel. Niska goryczka, dość wodniste. Niskie, fajne wysycenie. OK lager
Dans les bières de grande distribution c'est une de celle que je préfère. Bon équilibre, du goût, un peu léger tout de même mais bon correct. En bouteille plutôt que cannette.
Gekregen van Inoven, het is een goudgeel bier met een volle witte schuimkraag. Het heeft een lekkere smaak, wat zoet. Erg lekker!
Well, it's a French supermarket Lager. Like its peers it is rather weak in taste, drinkable of course when you're thirsty, but nothing that will deliver a memorable drinking experience.
Вполне себе неплохой лагерок за свою цену. Ничего невероятного но и не гадостно. Легкий солодовый вкус.

On tap.
Pours golden with white foam.
The taste is watery, with small citra notes. It's refreshing, but boring - nothing special. Better than a usual Tuborg though.
Pint at Mason's Arms, Kensal Rise. Aromas of crisp malts. Clear golden body, white head. Taste is quite watery with sweet malts. Average pale lager.

Malty aroma of biscuit and hay, also some grain. Straw coloured lager, although I'm disturbed they've used caramel colour to darken it. Taste is crisp and grainy with a slight metallic note in the finish that is common to the style. The body is light and the carbonation is lively. This is a good expression of the style, but not great.

Serve cold as at room temp it tastes like vomit, poured from bottle into glass it produces a small foamy head which surrenders quicker than napoleon. Oddly its 5.5% volume doesn’t appear to be present & you are left with a glass of flat pale yellow liquid what can best described as evian with has pasted though a human liver

0.5l can. Clear pale golden color with medium white head. Aroma: syrupy, corn presence, over ripped fruits. Taste: watery, semi sweet, syrup, sticky to tongue, bald. sour notes. Light body, moderate to live carbonation. Almost no bitterness. Not very tasty.
On tap. Pint. Pours a pale straw gold with a solid white head. Malt flavours dominate. Mild citrus flavours. Thin bodied. High carbonation moderate bitterness. Not a particularly pleasant beer.
Had this one at a friend’s bbq. Great company, great hosts, great friends, best setting to drink a good beer.
Clear, dark golden, medium head. Some grain, lemon and herbs in aroma and taste, a little bitterness. Not bad really.

Bue à la pression. Blonde bien limpide, mousse correcte pour de l’industriel. Nez légèrement fruité et un poil sur les grains, pas trop dégueulasse. Assez sèche, petite amertume, mais surtout très aqueuse et notes métalliques en fin de bouche. Pas grand chose en terme d’arômes. Pas grand intérêt.

Pours an average size slightly foamy head and has a yellowish straw coloured appearance. Patchy lacing. Pretty faint grainy malt and wheaty aromas. Flavours of light roasted malts, mild floral hops. Breads and grains as well. Has a bit of corn in it as well but not enough to detract. Mild creamy mouthfeel, pretty excessive carbonation. More watery in the finish. Light bodied. Not bad actually, just nothing special.
Standaard als Franse pils kan zijn, lichtzoet wat ok is als het buiten warm is. Niks bijzonders, te kopen in de camping winkel als de Supermarché dicht is.

Bottle pour into shaker pint glass from Greg & Janes Beer and Wine. Appearance is clear gold with light sparkle at sides of glass, fizzy white 1.5-finger width head with poor retention and light foamy lace. Aroma is bready malts and lightly floral. Taste is weak cracker malts, lightly tart. Palate is light bodied with thin texture, average carbonation and dry, crisp finish. Overall, thin and light. If that’s what you’re looking for, this is perfect.
Draught pint, served very cold, light malt and grassy hop aroma, something quite metallic on the finish

@ Röhällavägen 20170717. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty, grainy and mid sweet, grassy with straw, light caramely notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and grainy.
Fat boulebar. Gulaktig kulör. Brödig doft med lätt humletouch. Vattnig smak med viss fruktighet. Låg beska

Pale, lowest color (2 degrees Lovibond), soft, low alcohol content, mild aroma, minimal foam, weak taste, not bitter, mild aftertaste, easy to drink 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Normal hoppy lager with straw and grains. Taste is slight sweet graininess. Metallic finish but drinkable.
Bottle from Sebastian weyer. Nose is straw, wheat, some citrus. Palate is watery malty, faint wheat, bread. Not good

En ljus lager med en klar ljus krona med en doft av blöt hund och smak av karamell och en söt eftersmak men i stora hela en okey o lättdrucken öl

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Systembolaget (5,5%) color is golden and clear within medium white head. Taste and aroma of hops and malt. Ok an decent beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Color is clear golden with small head. Sweet and fruity aroma. Taste is à bit citrus with à sweet finish. One of the better lagers I experienced. Ok and easy to drink!

Sorry but for me this is one of the better mass-produced and commonly available lagers. Can be summed up as crisp, only the pale pour is genuinely sub-standard. Not much in the way of powerful flavours but when chilled I’d gladly opt for this on a hot summer’s day. Like choosing fast food over gourmet but going for Five Guys instead of McDonalds.
Nop, i cannot stand it anymore. I avoid it for yers but tonigth i had no choice. drinkable, but far from good

440ml can. Again these lagers are definitely a few marks higher out a can, rather than a green bottle ! Pours rusty amber with a decent creamy foam on top. Medium carbonation. Nose is bready, cereal grain, straw and lemon. Fairly watery mouth feel. Taste is slightly toasted bread, caramel sweetness and a light bitter finish with a touch of lemon. It’s not that bad at all, certainly refreshing and drinkable and a touch above the usual mass produced lagers.

Tesco was next door to Dominos where we were picking up the pizzas and this was all they had in. But on the hottest day of the year and at my in laws where there was nothing else, then beggars can’t be choosers. It was cold, fizzy, thirst quenching and complemented the pizza. The can also had a picture of Eric Cantona which was a bit odd. Not my usual, but it was very welcome and I did actually enjoy it; although that was more to do with the temperature of the day. And, you can’t drink craft beer and real ale all of the time.
[Butelka 02.2018] Barwa złota, piana obfita, średnio pęcherzykowa. W aromacie słodowe z nutą chmielu. W smaku delikatna goryczka, słodowość. Wodniste.
Botella 0,33L de Mahou S.L., España, Color dorada,espuma blanca, 1 dedo, fina, no resistente. Aroma- malta, cereales. Sabor-denso, malta, cereales, algo dulce, nada de amargor. No esta mal.Bebible

Pale yellow pour, virtually no head, overly lively carbonation. Aroma is wet grass. Uh-oh. Tastes far better than the aroma, grains, light malt, grassy, light metallic finish, somewhat sweet. Watery body. This is just there.

Kronenbourg is well known to the brits as being cheap for a 5 percent lager. Taste is generally a bit metallic and quite malty. The thing is with Kronenbourg, it’s not Stella, you can drink at least 7 British pints of it and feel okay and your wallet will feel relatively happy. Decent beer tbf, quite solid.

Aroma: Very subtle toated cereals.
Appearance: Gold/ambar color with clear sparkling liquid and white frothy head.
Taste: Medium bitterness and light sour notes.
Palate: Light body with oily texture and average carbonation. Short bitter finish.
Overall: Too subtle. Nice to drink cold.
Fizzy macro larger with some dry hops that contrast with bready malts okay macro beer

Pours light golden colored body with a frothy white head. 

Aroma of pale malts and corn. 

Taste is grain, malt, subtle hops. Little skunked.
Pretty standard. Hay, grain, malt and some caramel aroma. Wastery with a bit of hop bitterness to counter sweetness. Boring
Tasted many times. Typical Pale lager, with medium carbonation and yeasty/malty/watery finish. Next one please!
440ml can from Campus Central, Reading University. Taste is notably metallic, malts and grains, light carbonation, watery, light body.

A: Gold with a big white head. 
N: Not much. Some grain
T: Slightly sweet with some bitterness
P: Thin
O: Standard lager.

Drunk it more than one time. Last time keg during a weekend in Paris. Colour is clear yellow with a medium white head. Very common in France. Aroma is malty at most. Taste is poor, some bitterness. Body is medium to light, carbonation is average. Basic beer, more marketing than quality.

Pale colouration, average white head, soft carbonation, weak malty aroma, medium sweetness with light bitterness. Hints of malt and grains give a lighter taste. Overall a very easy drinking beer, best served in multitude after a long day
Not a bad session beer. A fine drinking lager. Could drink a hundred of these on a hot summer day!

Bottled. Poured clear golden/amber with an average sized frothy white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, grain, caramel and straw. Medium to heavy sweetness, light bitterness. Light body, slight oily and watery texture, soft to average carbonation. Finish is malty with touch of citrus.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden, medium size and long lasting white head, good lacing. Very faint aroma, sweet grains and bread. Light and fairly crisp feel, medium to high carbonation that works alright with the light body. Nothing too much going on in the taste, sweet white bread, grains and grass. Low bitterness.

Pale, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, thin feel, bitter finish.
Bought a tallboy at LCBO. Nothing special.
Cerveja comercial, sem pretensões. Notas de cereais e caramelo com baixa formação de espuma
caramel, cereal, pale, clear, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, light body, thin feel,lively,

Barwa złota, klarowne, piana biała, niska, niezbyt trwała. W aromacie nic się nie dzieje, minimalna słodowość. W smaku wodniste, lekko słodowe. Goryczka niska, wysycenie dość wysokie. Typowy eurosikacz.
Great appearance. My favourite French beer. Light taste with a crisp finish. Great for casual and formal events.

Bottle. Clear light gold with a frothy white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of toasted malt, straw, light wheat, caramel, and spice. Flavor is sweet grain, toasted malt, wheat, light spice. Light bodied, smooth with a dry finish.
33cl bottle @ dad’s place. Toujours avec du Picon pour donner du goût ! Elle en a besoin.
Wypite jakis czas temu, ocena w ramach uzupelnienia profilu. Zwykly lager, po prostu
Pint from keg at Wetherspoons. Regular lager, it doesn’t excel in anything, not the contrary. Correct, clean and light.
Когда бываю во Франции пью практич& всегда тольео этот лагер! Вполне приятны& вкус только цена в 12 евро за 0.5 убивает

Bière blonde de 5 % d’alcool. Elle possède un odorat de bière commerciale ( O’Keefe) et de moufette. Elle possède un petit col mousseux au versement. Elle possède un goût âcre, légèrement amer, mais l’amertume reprend en finale. Elle possède également un petit goût salé. Correcte et rafraîchissante.
Better than expected. Grassy aroma. Light golden color with a light, highly carbonated palate. Flavors where of cereal and lager yeast. Some hop presence. Easy to drink.

500ml can. (5% ABV) Pours a clear gold with a medium, creamy, long lasting, white head that leaves curtains of lace. Mild aroma of wheat malt and corn. Sweet flavour of wheat malt, caramel and corn with mild grass bitterness in the finish. Light body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. Smooth and easy drinking.

A small bottle from Jason’s near NCCU, drunk at home. Aroma: a faint suggestion of hops, floral. Appearance: Clear golden, minimal head. Palate: light-bodied, rather thin, average carbonation, some bitterness at the end. Taste: lightly bitter with a faintly sweet aftertaste. Unexceptional, too much of this will probably give you tummy ache.
Piwo barwy złotej, piana średnio obfita, ltrwała. W aromacie słodowa słodycz. W ssłodowe, lecz dość wytrawne i kwaskowate.

On tap for this review, but I’ve had plenty of times from bottle, can and tap before. Pours pale straw with decent head. Aroma is generic lager: vinegar and vegetable stuff. Flavour has a little fruitiness to it as well. One of those beers where I’ve drunk a lot during my life, but when forced to actually think about what it tastes like, I’ve no idea why.
Cerveza de estilo pale lager media. Aroma suave y escaso, apariencia amarillo pálido, sabor agradable pero muy suave (cuerpo bajo) y paladar correcto pero casi imperceptible.
Color Biondo, poca schiuma, al naso tanti cereali, anche al palato dolcezza di malto e cereali. Carbonazione medio alta.
Francuski przedstawiciel stylu. Lager jakich wiele. Słabo wyczuwalny chmiel.
Canned. It’s hard to distinguish these mass-produced lagers but I’ve had many worse.

On tap at The Woolpack Inn, Leicester on 04-Feb-2017. Clear light pale amber with a medium sized white head. Aroma of sweet malt, grain and bread, Light to medium body and heavily carbonated. Taste of grain and sweet breads. Light bitterness. Pretty boring commercial lager.
Slight herbal aroma, pours golden. Very thin mouth feel, slightly sweet aftertaste, nothing much going on really.
11.2 oz. bottle. Pour was clear golden, large white head. Aroma was grassy, green vegetables. Taste was light bitterness, grassy.
Butelka. Aromat słodowy, lekko utlenione, lagerowe. W smaku jak lager, nic specjalnego, goryczka bardzo niska.

Bottle.Clear pale straw,thick,not very beautiful but quite stable white head,some lacing.Aroma malty,slight dms,weak cardboard.Taste sweetish,malty.Carbonation medium.Bitterness very low.Aftertaste malty,cardboard,corn.Weak and boring.
Backlog. Przenoszenie ocen z innego serwisu, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer
Pours gold with a thick white head strong malt aroma not a whole lot of flavor which is probably good more drinkable that way. Bottle from World Of Beers Middleton Wi
Bière de très grande distribution. Aucune autre vertu que la désaltération.

Can on a Delta flight from Paris to Seattle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is grainy, bready, with some malt sweetness. Taste is sweet malts, bready, . Silky mouthfeel with medium to high soft carbonation. Drinkable.

Piwo barwy złotej, piana średnio obfita, lecz bardzo nietrwała. W aromacie słodowa słodycz. W smaku dziwne, nieco słodowe, lecz dość wytrawne i kwaskowate. Ogólnie jest kiepsko, a nawet bardzo kiepsko. Nie polecam.
puszka 500ml. pity dawno temu, nie był jakiś super tragiczny, ale też zły nie był.
Pours a slightly golden straw from a bottle, tastes like sweet adjuncts, but much more drinkable than a lot of the skunky American ubiquitous mass-produced lagers. Meh.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Pours hazy straw color with a soapy, 3-finger white head. Lemony aroma with a touch of spice to it. Body is light and a touch watery. Dry finish with a light astringency. Flavor is lemony with a grassy note. Mild spice note too. Maybe some peach as it warms.
Kolor złoty,klarowne, piana słaba ale trzyma się szkła. Aromat słodowy, trochę kwiatów. Smak słodowy, goryczka w normie, lagerowa, piwo typowe dla lagera koncernowego.

33cl bb03/2017, BL sampler 4. - Drinkable wheat powder sweet, hop extract perfumed pale lager with minimum metallics or skunk at optimal freshness. It doesn’t even get in the way of imagining some Alsatian hops in the perfume, once the adjunct wheat sugars (ground almonds in cheap marzipan) subside. Otherwise watery as intended, with again a sweet perfumy flavour and aftertaste (sugared rose water). Mostly clean.
24-11-16 // can in St. Etienne, France. Typical macro lager. Light bodied, grainy. Light bitter.
Yellow, clear with nice white foam. Mild aroma of sweet metal. Sweet, toffee, with sweet but growing metal in the aftertaste.
Very common bottle in France. Had it when travelling with my wife over there. Gold color. Taste is somewhat sweet and a little bit bitter. Can’t find that much aroma here.
Caña 25cl Sidreria El Acebo (Oviedo) Típica cerveza industrial, con un leve, muy leve toque lupulado

$1.99 bottle from World Market. Pours yellow, small white head. Aroma of grass, corn, and general cheap ass beer without being offensive. Taste is corn water, grass, wheat, hint of skunk, bit of bread. It’s not offensive, but to seek this out and choose this as the beer you’re drinking is inconceivable to me (I’m drinking for the sake of rating).

Sampled from a 12 oz bottle this beer poured a golden color with a medium sized foamy white head that left minimal lacing. The aroma was a bit tangy and sweet with a bit of grassy hops. The flavor was sweetish and tangy, a bit corny and had a hint of grassy and perfumey hops. Medium length finish. Light to medium body. Bland.
Clear golden beer with minimal white head. Aroma is grass, malt. Taste is slightly sweet and little bit bitter. Quite watery, light body. Drinkable mass production lager.
Can from Kiwi. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma and taste is malt, grass, corn, straw, floral hops. Light body. Soft carbonation. Sweet finish.
Aroma of sweet malts. Mild flavour of banana and bitter finish from the hops. It is not great, but nothing wrong with it at all.
From the bottle. Nearly nonexistent aroma. Golden straw color and light foamy head. Decent balance of malt and hops, but somewhat thin and watery.
Pamiętamy, świetne piwo miało to być. Kiedyś się piło, bo było drogie i lekkie.w smaku. Poza tym było znane. A teraz? Nie mam pojęcia.
Puszka z datą: 02.2017
Mało intensywny. Wyczuwalne estry (jabłko). Reszta taka jak zawsze w lagerach, czyli słodowość. W tle lekki "skunks".
Barwa złota, klarowne. Piana wysoka, krótka.
Słodowe, wodniste i co "ważne" - wyjałowione ze smaku.
Trzyma poziom, poziom "international lager".
Golden with white head. Cereal and floral. Slick, light citrus and malty finish. Okay.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass

Appearance – The beer is pours a clear golden color with a one finger head of white foam. The head has a moderate level of retention fading to leave just a trace of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

Smell – The aroma of the brew is very light overall, consisting mostly of a cardboard smell mixed with a little bit of skunk. These flavors are accompanied by some lighter caramel and grassy smells as well.

Taste- The taste begins with a bready and caramel flavor mixed with a little bit of herb. These flavors create a base for the beer and persist throughout the taste profile. More toward the end, some skunk and a little bit of grass come to the tongue, leaving one with a somewhat sweeter, but overall rather smooth taste to linger on the tongue.

Mouthfeel – The body of the brew is on the average to thinner side with a carbonation level that is rather normal. For the lighter bready flavors of the brew the feel is rather nice and makes for an easy sipping beer.

Overall – A rather standard brew overall. Easy drinking, but nothing all that exceptional.
Cette bière omniprésente chez nous français n’est quand même pas très glorieuse. Désaltérante, on lui reconnaîtra au moins ça ...

Flesje gedronken tijdens vakantie. Helder goudkleurig bier met weinig, grof schuim. Fruitig, iets hoppig en kruidig aroma. De smaak is zoetig en fruitig. Nasmaak is bitterig en vloeit licht uit. Een pils van een goed gemiddelde.
Colour is clear pale yellow. Aroma is sweet n yeasty. A little bananafruity. Taste is balanced between sweet, bitter n sour. Quite watery, light body with medium carbonation.
From a bottle. Not bad, not great, decent for a macro lager that made it all this way.
Draft at Epcot. Pours hazy gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like dough, corn, lemon, and grassy malt. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like dough, corn, and grassy malt.

30ml bottle BB 8/16 (uh-oh....)
Fruity malt aroma.
Light amber gold color with sudsy head and good lacing.
Unfortunately the taste was pretty much wet cardboard with mild bitterness and a slight malt palate.
Would be worth re-tasting a fresher version of this.

Can @ DTU with colleges. Appearance: pours clear yellow with ok white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, straw with some floral notes. palette: weak malty aroma, average carbonation, light body, light to medium sweetness, balanced by a light to medium bitterness, medium duration and a watery texture. Overall: decent standard lager

Ciemnozlota barwa. Obfita biala piana, która jednak szybko opada. W aromacie przewaza slód. Smak mocno chlebowy, slodowy, lekko karmelowy. Piwo slodkawe, wyklejajace. Praktycznie nie ma goryczki. Slabe, zdecydowanie za duzo slodyczy i za malo ciala.

440 ml can in Oban Scotland. BB date of May 2017. 

Clear golden body with a generous, durable foamy head. Nice lacing.
Medium-light with lively carbonation. 
Plenty of earthy and floral hops in the aroma. These are more subdued in the flavor. Mild bitterness.
Pours yellow with a white head. Grass, grain and floral hop aroma and flavors. Light body and moderate carbonation. Floral and grassy finish.
Can. Aroma of malts,bread. Taste is watery,malts,bread. Almost no bitterness.
0,25l fles op vakantie in de Dordogne. Had er niet veel van verwacht en het bier maakt de verwachtigingen waar. Emotieloos en zoet pilsbier, ik zou het voor de smaak zeker niet nog een keer pakken.
Bonne bière, mousse légère, arômes multiples et parfois surprenant, niveau gustatif généreux. Globalement une bière sympathique
Bottle at Chez Jozephine. Poured gold yellow with white head. Aroma sweet malty sugar. Light carb med bod. Taste sweet sugar corn syrup.
Pours light gold with small white head. Aroma is malt and grass. Taste is much like aroma with a metallic aftertaste. Not bad but nothing special.

Tried it while on vacation at the insistence of the waiter because according to him it was a great beer for hot weather. It pours golden with some foam, very faint aromas, and no complexity. Definitely a great beer for warm weather.
50 cl i La Rochelles hamn. Fantastisk miljö inte så fantastisk öl. En helt vanlig lager med andra ord.
Tap at Golden Lion with Jacobarts. Good fresh beer, easy to drink, but not one to remember
Tap at golden lion with Christian Hansen. Small white head. Light golden. Not much aroma. Taste is fresh. Watery texture. Fine beer
Bottle 330mL. Price 0,79 eur . Skaidrius, geltonas, nedidelė, balta puta. Geras skonis
Pale golden colour, small white head. Aroma of malt, grass, hops. Dry lightly sweet taste with subtle bitterness in finish. Thin body and average carbonation.

Une bière moyenne dans l’ensemble, dite standard.
Pas trop de goût et assez correct au niveau du palais

0,5L can at Camping Kost-Ar-Moor. Clear pale golden with fluffy white head, good head retention. Sweet malts, grain/wheat, light chalky, ground bitter hops, bit tin can metallic. Light sweet, light bitter. Thin body, average carbonation, stale bitter finish.

Taki oto lager pod mecz został otwarty. Piana wysoka, biała. Opadła szybciej niż powstała i zostawiła brzydkie ślady na szkle. Aromat słaby, lekko słodowy. W smaku oprócz słodu i lekkiej goryczki bardzo dziwne odczucie. Nuta, którą znałem raczej z piw ciemnych - przypominała spalone kable. Utrzymywało się to do ostatniego łyka... Oprócz tego piwo bardzo rozwodnione i pozbawione smaku... Słabiutko...

Robe dorée et limpide. La mousse ne tient pas. Arômes floral et céréales. Goût biscuit, levure. Aqueuse, pas de tenue en bouche.

Easy going and easy to drink beer. Not an exceptional tasting beer but good to have in the fridge. A little of young/fresh hops are tasted, but the taste disappears fast from the mouth. To my personal taste it is not as sour as the Kronenbourg Alsace. For me its one of the better pilsner alternatives in the french supermarkets.

Half pint at the Clarendon Arms, Cambridge. The only beer in the pub I’ve yet to tick. To be fair, she is a comely lass: dark yellow, small white head, tempting carbonation - not too much, not too little. And the smell isn’t terrible, there’s just not a lot of it. Taste is a bit blasé but again not terrible, sugary and slightly lemony. Nicely carbonated finish but the alcohol is fairly exposed, even for an ABV this low. Substandard but it’ll do.
33cl bottle, served cold. Bubbly. Intensely bubbly. Too bubbly to drink comfortably. And not worth any discomfort - pretty boring and watery, though not actively unpleasant apart from the bubbles.
It sucks bad, but it’s drinkable. No words necessary, this is a common Lager, a bit lighter than classic Kronenbourg, but still not interesting. DISAPPROVED BY TAVERNY’S BLACK METAL CREW !

Bottle from Bert’s Bierhuis in Utrecht. The beer is golden colored and a small and stable white head, with nice carbonation. 
The aroma is hoppy and malty, with also tones of grains, bread, yeast and a hint of citrus. 
The taste is light bodied, light sweet and malty and has some notes of grass and citrus and has further quiet a watery texture.
The finish leaves some refreshing notes and a medium bitterness which is long noticable.

Slick light body with prickly carbonation. Well balanced finish, ending with slightly dry wine like sweet grainy feel and pleasant tongue numbing noble spices.

Overall a good craft offering decent flavors, good freshness, and a nice warming finish. Although a little unbalanced being too syrupy.

Pours a light golden color. Pretty thick white head. Okay retention, good lacing. Very clear. Pretty well carbonated.
Aroma is the typical Euro lager smell. Bready, fresh. Light grassy and floral hops. Light, and welcoming.
Taste is quite refreshing. Fresh, clean. Bready and slightly hoppy.
Mouthfeel is light and refreshing. Slightly dry and poppy. I say poppy because typically, I might say crisp,but it’s not quite that. It has a pop. Weird, yeah, but it’s the best I can come up with.
Overall, it’s good. Perhaps better than the similar Euro lagers. Nothing great, but it is quite good. I would recommend it, and I would buy it again.

11.2 oz bottle, poured into a shaker. The aroma is dry minerals, apple pie, and bread. The appearance is a brilliant, oily pale orange with a soapy white head that has a moderate, creamy retention, and a decent lace. The taste is a medium sweet and light bitter. The thin, oily texture has a foamy carbonation. The medium light body is flavored by apple pie and citrus, with a finish that’s crisp with mellow citrus, bread, and light spice. The dry, astringent aftertaste has a mineral and light spice touch.

33 cl green bottle, 4,5% ABV. Yellow to straw colour, thin white head, some rolling carbonation, crystal clear. Aroma is... standard. It’s pale malt, wheat and corn adjuncts. Nothing special. Mouthfeel is dry and bitter from the hop extracts. Flavours of white bread and malts, and it’s sweet. All in all not a bad beer at all. Great drinkability, could easy have several of these, especially if I was in a French boardwalk cafe in the summer.

Can from Local Offie; clear burnished amber pour with massive frothy white head, malt and sweet caramel aroma, taste has fairly robust malt, wet card, sweet caramel, drank loads of times before pre rating days, to be its ok didn’t pour, like the last juan.

Poured from the a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass at the World of Beer in Cary, NC. This beer is a golden yellow color with a small white head. The aroma has some hops and grass to it, pretty mild. The flavor matches the aroma and I was surprised by the full but plain flavor, very enjoyable. the beer was well balanced and had a great mouthfeel.

One of better massive production Eu lager beers. Well balanced, without any disgusting notes. Very clean and smooth lager. Alcohol is nicely hidden and above average. Crisp and lightly creamy. Nice golden colour and nice white top. Finally one Eu lager to recommend!

On tap on a local pub of Bermondsey, London - UK. Color: clear blond beer with high carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel malt notes. Not really dominated by something. Taste: sweet caramel and malt, caramel finish astringence normal and small bitterness. Nothing really special. Aftertaste: wet bitterness. Easy drinkable.
Tap, Color amarillo dorado, aroma ligero, sabor malta, final astringente, tomada en n bonito bar mirando a la playa.
Aroma dominated by grains, touch of alcohol. Taste is a weak bitterness, wet cardboad.

330 ml bottle into lager glass, bottled on 12/23/2014. Pours crystal clear golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of lemon, wheat, cracker, biscuit, light honey, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with well balanced pale malt and earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of lemon, wheat, cracker, biscuit, light honey, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Light herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of wheat, cracker, biscuit, light honey, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice robustness and balance of pale malt and earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Very clean on lager flavors with minimal yeast ester notes present. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, fairly crisp, and lightly creamy/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish as expected of 5%. Overall this is a very nice pale lager style. All around good robustness and balance of pale malt and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

11.2 Fl. Oz. Poured yellow, clear, fizzy and with a nice big and foamy white head that left lots of lacing. Aroma of grain and yeast. Taste is bready and sweet, some malts and even some hints of hops. Refreshing, drinkable, does what it is supposed to do...

Draught, somewhere in the Pays de la Loire. Rather better than your standard Eurolager. Taste is only slightly sweetish, with a good combination of malt/hop balance and bitterness. Thin body and watery on palate, though.

Bottle at home, picked up at warehouse liquors. Clear golden pour with a big white head and ok lacing. Skunky, grassy, herbal hoppy, biscuity, and green apples in the aroma. Taste is husky, crackery, some skunk, light pear, grass, and straw with a crisp finish - a lot of malt presence. Medium body high cabroantion. Not a bad pale lager.

light sweet and moderate bitter with a average duration.

Bottiglia. L’intensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è discreta, per non dire lunga. Gusto al naso presenta sentori di orzo. La schiuma, compatta, persiste e lascia anche del pizzo sul vetro. Il perlage è con bollicine medio-fini, dalla frizzantezza media e morbida. La limpidezza è pulita, di colore giallo dorato. Corpo pieno. Struttura oleosa. L’aroma alla lingua è di un dolce leggero sbilanciato da un amaro pesante. Intensità gustativa elevata. Persistenza gustativa lunga. Gusto molto piacevole. Sensazioni boccali finali discretamente luppolate. Finale amarognolo, felpato, secco, lungo e pulito con retrogusto intenso.

DATE REVIEWED: June 21, 2014... GLASSWARE: Blanche de Chambly pokal... OCCASION: Willow Lake orientation day...APPEARANCE: cascading bubbles round out a clear golden body; thick white head--exhibits excellent white cloudy lacing... AROMA: fragrant Saaz with soft lemongrass and some wheat yeasts--fresh and energizing (and unexpected)... PALATE: soft, almost creamy champagne-like (unavoidable comparison?) and smooth; light, clean, dry aftertaste... TASTE: a bit maltier than anticipated; refreshing with some fruitiness and honey accents... OVERALLL: a surprisingly strong profile for a beer--a French beer, at that--I had long forgotten since our trip abroad in ’03..this beer poured fresh, presented well, cleansed the palate as a pilsner is apt to do, and offered just enough flavor to elicit a satisfied night....

Review: Can of Kronenbourg Pale Lager, 5.5%ABV
Kronenbourg 1664 is France’s No.1 selling beer, and a nice refreshing beer with a lot of interesting flavours.

The appearance is a lovely clear amber colour, with a nice frothy white head. The appearance has the wow factor, it looks really like a beer you definitely want to drink.

The smell is not strong but you can get both a nice faint sweetness and a fruity aroma off the beer.

Taste has a mixture of different flavours from fruit, sweet caramel malts, honey, to a sweet malt taste at the start followed up with a mild hop bitterness. All in all a nice crafted beer and quite an enjoyable drinking experience mainly due, in my opinion, to the complexity of the flavours. Truly a well balanced beer.

Golden yellow colour; One-quarter finger head and soapy white foam which fades in 20 seconds; Small sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation; Pungent smell of malt, with initial light skunk (completely dissipated in 2 minutes), strong syrup, bread, lemon and light grass; Very light sweet taste of light malt, with shades of light Belgian Ale, faint syrups, light bread, light yeast, faint lemon and hint of grassy hops; Light body, thin and slightly slick palate; Mouth feel is - and I mean it - a bare bone base of light Belgian Ale, without sweetness, esters, booze and Bel yeast. Only the malt is more Lager-like, probably due to a good portion of wheat malt and unmalted wheat in the mix. Light bread, slightly yeasty, fairly clean. Not bad!... Hoppiness is initial skunk then light lemon and grass nose, faint lemon and only hint of grass taste. No bitterness, just malty and wheaty finish; Fairly dry after taste, very easy to mouth.

Comments: Just when I thought this is another despicable macro, I am really surprised by this strongly wheaty and Belgian Ale-like characters. Make no mistake, it uses syrup to thin out the body, and hop extract is minimal at best, but the overall taste is very clean, inoffensive, and Belgian-wise it’s quite charming for a macro Pale. A go-to macro Pale for snobs, and I wouldn’t mind to be one ;)

Tap - small foamy head, pale straw color, sweet and fruity aroma and flavor, pretty typical Euro lager

from can. clear pale yellow with a decent white head, little retention, some lacing. faint malts, corn, very hint of wheat, some lemony notes, bland cereals, light herbal notes. aggressive carbonation, light body, short herbal-citrusy finish. not horrible.
Bottle.  Grains, corn, light malt and hops.  Plain and watery, inoffensive but without any discernible redeeming characteristics.

660ml bottle - Pours a sparkling pale straw. Nose of grass, spice, and cereal. The fully lasting wispy white frothy head leaves light lace on the glass. A light watery body is very lively with a clean feel to the finish. Nondescript lager.

17.01.13(instant pression Dose):Gushing!Na das fängt ja gut an. Gold-gelb, trüb(soll das so sein???) Fester weißer Schaum. Sehr schwaches Aroma. Ich finde leichte Malz bzw Brotspuren. Der Geschmackist stark verwässert! Schmeckt leicht hefig. Die bittere fängt schnell und heftig ein. Bei weiteren Schlücken ist sie zurückhaltendender. Ziemlich vollmundig, kaum Co2! Ich habe nicht viel erwartet und wurde diesbezüglich nicht enttäuscht.
First tried on tap in Edinburgh, Scotland. Have since had on tap in NYC and in bottle.Pale lager, thin white head with a mild flavor.
Pours clear gold..thin light white head..  skunky aroma..taste is lije a watered down heineken

Boks 0,5l fra U-Express, Nice. Veranda”kos” i rue Rossini 11 Okt 12. Delt med verandakassen. Litt opp-spritet boksdesign merket “Edition Limiteé”. Veldig lys gylden med et lavt skum som fester seg litt til glasset. Lite aroma. Litt søtlig frukt. Veldig vassen smak. Papp. Svakt søtlig avslutning.
Light straw color in appearance and very carbonated. Mildly bitter hops and pretty much the French version of Miller lite.

Can down the Half Moon on Pram Race day - 26/12/12 (poured some to an empty glass for appearance rate).
Clear pale yellow with a frothy white head that collapses to the edge.
Nose is pale malt, grain, light citrus.
Taste follows, a little lemon, grain, papery cardboard dullness.
Light to medium in body, spritz and finish in the carbonation.
Dull lager but better than some if its luminaries!
330 ml bottle Pours clear golden with a small white head. Typical fruity pale lager aroma and taste. Mild finish. Average.
Small white head, clear golden colour. Peachy aroma. Watery taste and a lightly fruity palate.

Pale yellow clear body. Medium lacing head. Aroma is hay, hops, malts and some fir. Palate is soft , flat watery, carbonation soft. Taste is malty, fruity as some basic corn ice beer with added dryness from some citrus juice but not sweet. Finish short mild little bitter and dry. Overall typical bulky tasteless lager with some interesting fruity citrus flavors. OK for one time tasting.

330 ml bottle. A pale straw with a white head. Taste is similar to most other pale lagers out there. Only notable difference: some interesting orange-citrus finish to it. I was not expecting that. Quality over-commercialized brew.

500 ml. can thx. to Phillip & ?Dennis?? - smell is very grainy, skunky, metallic grains, tad chemical. Taste is very bitter in a non-hoppy way, disgusting, cereal, grains, very bitter metallic, aluminium, bitter herbal, touch cereal. Not particularly enjoyable - didn’t finish the can. Fizzy bodied.
Átlagos gyengén komlózott lager, nem túl erős malátasággal. A kevésbé keserű söröket kedvelőknek lehet kedvence.
33 cl bottle. Golden pale color with pretty small white head. Nice malty and wheat maybe even some rice in aromas. Neutral nose but all in all good mass lager. Great refreshment.
Draft at Fermentation. Clear pour with a almost no head. Aroma is pale grains, light sweetness and euro piss. Flavor is the same. More bland crap. How do you rate something that has no taste?

Iiiiiiiiiiittttttttsssss a premium lager. Lager lager lager lager mega mega white thing mega mega whithe thing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle @ Wild Wing Ottawa.  Pours a clear gold with a foamy white head.  Aroma is skunk, some yeast/bread, perhaps some overripe berry.  Taste is malt dominant up front with skunk on the backend.  Light body, mild carbonation.  Not the greatest of beers.

Can. Pours clear with thin white head. Weak, slightly metallic aroma. Agreeable, light golden colour. Richly carbonated. A clear taste of hop with a dryish aftertaste. Not bad as such, but nothing really special, either.

#775
 Kurz vorm verdursten in Colmar getrunken: Ein Segen für die Trinkerseele, aber sonst eher durchschnittlich: Pilsähnliches Outfit, leicht hopfig im Aroma...der Antrunk ist dann eher wässrig-malzig mit ner Spur Hopfen...geht garantiert besser...aber für nen Franzosen ganz gut ;)
	
Test vom 11.12.2006, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 12,9,9,8,-,8 - 8,73
On tap in Paris. Golden color. Thin head. Medium carbonation. Not so artificial aroma. Not bad.

330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with average, frothy, white head. Dull pale malty aroma, a touch of apple. Taste is minimally sweet pale malty, minimally grainy, hints of apple or the like, decent bitter hoppy note. At least good enough to see why Pale Lager may be a style worth to work on at all.
Fairly light with cereal grain and bready malt flavors.  Finish is fairly quick and slightly metallic.
ok lager, nothing special though. Diificult to separate from all other mainstream lagers out there.
A pale, clean and crisp lager. Fine for drinking at a pub. Aromatic for a large scale brew. A fine, drinkable tipple.
From bottle in Bergen. Pale golden. Watery, not much taste. Not much bad taste either - just very, very average lager.
5.0% gold colour with a thin head, not the worst you can get, good cold on a hot day in France.

Tried this beer on tap at The Flying Saucer in Addison, TX. Not very much here, slight fruity taste, sweet aroma. Make sure it's really cold.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear gold with a minimal white head.  Smells of bread, hay, barnyard.  Taste is sweet with a light bitterness - almost like a dinner roll with honey butter.  A little too sweet for a beer, and the hops are mild.  A hint of herbs and flowers.

- Fruity taste. 
- Sweet smell, almost berry-like. 
- Goes down pretty easy.
Had on tap at a Buffalo Grill restaurant in France. Average lager, decent taste, went well with food....

We organized a very interesting tasting of Lagers (basic to average quality): 16 different beers from different countries. Price range: from EUR 0.3/bt (supermarket) to EUR 3.5/bt (take-away at sushi bar). All beers have been blind-tasted; we were 4 people, great beer lovers and wanted to know If there is a difference between all these basics summer beers. Answer: no, all were more our less watery, the worst one was bad water. 1664 was poor water, with bad paper notes.
Here is the ranking: #1 Sapporo Yebisu #2 Baltika 3 #3 Duff #4 Obolon Svitle #5 Svyturys Ekstra Draught #6 Heineken #7 Kirin Ichiban #8 1664 #9 Carlsberg #10 Burger #11 Kronenbourg #12 Pilsner Urquell #13 Königsbacher #14 33 Export #15 Tsingtao #16 Asahi

Draft to pint. Looks alright; gold with white head that slowly dissipates into lacing. Smells bitter and a little skunky like a decent mass-produced European Pale Lager. Tastes like it smells with a hint of fermented cider in there too. Average on the palate. Not bad; easy to drink, and better than BMC.
The carbonization disappears instantly, the beer in general is too thin, and the bitterness is missing. Moderate refreshing.
330ml bottle, pours yellowy amber, no head. Lively carbonation, not much on the nose, fairly plain flavour, some hops, nothing to see here
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Aroma of stinky shoes, very light head. Taste of bitter hops, but with a certain sweetness. Drinkable but not close to delicious.

Different 0,33 l bottles. Is that really a lager ? At this moment that’s just water with some hops and pepper aroma. Watery, nothing-saying lager which also could be nothing saying pilsner or helles. Below average.
Pours pale yellow, nose of heavy skunk, and lemons. Bitter at first, and actually not as skunky as the smell indicates. A little flavor of wheat and lemon along with some malty characteristics.

Canned, 0.5l. Clear light golden color with thin frothy white head and lively carbonation. Aroma of barley and corn malt, herbal hops and some lemony notes. Taste starts with mild sweet malt, mouthfeel is quite plain, while finish is crisp and dry. Light body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. Not more than average...

On keg at the Edinburgh Fringe Fest. Pours a light golden colour with a fair white head. Aroma of corn, bready yeast and caramel. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation, light CO2 prickle and a foamy mouth-feel. A very corny linger.

Bière de couleur dorée et limpide, ayant une mousse typique qui se dissipe dans le temps de le dire, laissant très peu de dentelle. Odeurs maltées, rappelant plusieurs bières commerciales. À part le malt, il y a des senteurs gazéifiées et métalliques. Goût qui joue dans les mêmes cordes, avec un soupçon de sirop de maïs. En insistant, une légère amertume reste en arrière-goût et c’est éphémère. C’est mince en bouche. Bière brassée pour la masse. Ça ressemble à de l’eau minérale. Plutôt insipide. Bière sociale. (302-080812)

16th August 2012 ’let’s start with a couple of these before we start on your nice beers’

How about let’s not?

Saying that, this isn’t as bad as I feared.

Re-rated 7/11/12 actually it is. Rubbish. Pish.
Nah, nothing to be excited about... Just a pale lager with no character. (I’m positive the lager is still better than their witbier though).
A light alcoholized taste, that becomes too bitter, hoppy palate without proper balance. White, medium thick foam stays for 2 minutes. Good, golden colour.
Celkem použitelné francouzké pivo. Trochu více kysličené než by bylo vhodné, ale zas tolik to nevadilo. Zkusil jsem teď v Paříži jak lahváč, tak točené, ani jedno nenadchlo ale ani nezklamalo.

Bottle poured a golen straw with a small white head, active carbonation, and no lacing.  Aroma of bready malt with a hint of grass.  Taste is similarly one note of malts and slight fruity sweetness.  Not a bad beer with food  if only one on the menu at a French bistro.

12 oz bottle from New Seasons - Yellow with minimal white head.  Pretty much looks like a macro-brew lager.  Euro aroma.  Not too surprising.  Decent beer.  Not great, not bad.  I would drink more than one.
Keg. Straw and bubbly. White top. Mostly maize nose with a slight lemony hop. Bit of a syrupy mouth in taste, but with a decent slight lemon hop cutting through. Bland, but not too offensive.
033 Can. Not a big one. Malty sweet aroma. Malty, sweet taste with balanced bitterness, little bit sweet. Average pale lager.
Very light, not really to my taste. Nothing very special in this beer at all.
Bottle. A pale golden colour with a thin head, grainy malty aroma, taste is malty and a bit sweet.
Pours golden with a small head. For a cheap lager, it’s light and easy to drink, but most beers would be better.

From bottle to glass.  Pours golden color, white foam. Earthy, damp, there’s that Euro-lager aroma that I can’t describe.  Taste is a little sour.  Seems tingly and thin.  Overall, has a little bit of a bad taste.

Pours to good-sized head with nice retention; golden color at bottom.  Sporadic lacing.  Smell is nice blend of light grass and fruits.  Taste - slightly earthy and metallic; not much hops.  Notice wheat malt the most.  Not much aftertaste.  Wish the flavor held up to the aroma, but I’ve certainly had worse, especially in the pale lager category.
bottle to glass.  nice grassy aroma.  decent looking beer.  I got no problem with the taste - lager with slight hops; drinkable beer.

Pours a clear pale yellow. Off white head falls right away to a whisp. Smell is light malt, a touch of fruit. Taste is similar to the nose with a little hop tartness and dryness at the end.  Light and thin body below average carbonation level. Overall not a particularly good beer but better than its Kronenbourg sibling.
On tap and on bottle. Typical macro brewed lager => tasteless. I don’t recommend it...
This beer tasted like Stella Artois’ little cousin. The flavor was weaker, but you could sense the relationship. Overall good.
Lighter yellow with huge white foam head. Ata camping when the temperature is 30C this is a perfect pilsener. Aroma is OK, so is taste. (Strasbourg 201207)

This lager sets a standard for being clean and refreshing. Super easy drinking well balanced pale lager. The green bottle causes some worry but if fresh enough no off taste can be found. Have had some with off aroma/skunky so fresh is the key.  With good batches I almost want to say its silky on the tongue with no bad aftertaste. Good beer all year round especially in warm weather.

Poured a clear pale golden yellow with a foamy white head that lasted and laced. Aroma of light malt and traces of hops. Taste slightly of malt then a mild hops bitterness. Light to medium body. Finish slightly metallic.
En canette.  Dorée, odeur de sirop de maîs.  Sucré, soupçon de houblon timide, pas grand chose d’autre.  Meilleur qu’une Bud...
Clear gold with a white head.  Aroma is sweet, lightly malty. Medium, oily body. Flavor is sweet malts, light hay/grass.  Short, mild bitter finish. Meh.
Aromo is mild with hay. Clear copper, short head and some lacing. Slightly malty and short taste has also some butter. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation. Easy to drink beer with no challenge.
Tap. Cleat yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, hop and a little grainy. Flavour is malt, medium swete, hop, little grainy, little watery and a little bitter.
Light floral aroma. Taste is more grass and wood, but it?s too watery. Finish has some bitterness and sourness. Not a very good lager.
It has a very light taste and light brown in color.  It seems carbonated but has a good aroma.

Poured a very clear and pale yellow color with a thin white head.  Aroma is slightly skunky with some rice and sweet malts.  Taste has some rice with a good amount of pale malts.  Some hay with some slight bitterness from hops.  Aftertaste is very sweet.
Clear to slightly gold color. Kind of a skunk aroma but crisp refreshing taste and aftertaste. If I have to drink a beer from France it?d be this one.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.

Tap. Pours yellow gold with a medium white head that disappears quickly with some lacing. Aroma is medium sweet floral, honey and grain. Flavor is less sweet than nose, grain dominated, with a lightly bitter finish, sweetness returning in the far finish. Perfectly drinkable.
Clear pale gold with a fizzy white head. Grainy and lightly floral nose, corny. Rather sweet grain flavors, a bit of grass. Disappears quick.

500ml can. Pours a medium yellow gold (Lovibond 6). Small but good head, and adequate lacing. Smells of apples, butter and hops. Lively action - lots of bubbles. Moderate carbonation. Tastes like cider, with a creamy hoppy bitterness that rounds out the swig. Slightly unbalanced... Somewhat ascorbic aftertaste.  Nice dry finish.

The world of mainstream lager is not one I massively enjoy dipping into but Kronenbourg is my easily available lager of choice. On tap this can have surprising depth of flavour and body for a standard lager, especially when I had it in Paris. Bottled it is superior to the average but loses a little of its taste when canned. Very easy to drink if not spectacularly good.
Light golden color with good head retention. it has taste of bitter hop. It+’s nicely carbonated. Good beer but nothing special. Just another european lager.
330ml bottle. Just your stock standard pale lager, Nothing special, but drinkable.

330 ml bottle. Pours clear golden with medium-sized white head. Aroma has plenty of rubber, some grain, grassy hops and distant sweet notes. Tastes exactly like mineral water. Flavour has also some mild sweet malt. Light bodied, watery mouthfeel and stingy carbonation. Very watery but somehow well-balanced. Boring though.
not a bad beer on tap, though out of the bottle you get a bit of skunk aroma.  must be served cold
It’s drinkable, but astoundingly boring. Incredibly simple brew, this is like if you homebrewed a SMaSH (Single Malt and Single Hops) with the specific intent to make the most boring beer possible.
As mass produced lagers go this one is not too bad. Average malty taste, no unpleasant aftertaste.

330 ml bottle with 4,7% alcohol
Bought @ Centra,Majorstuen,Oslo
Beer straight from the bottle @ home, May 26,2012
A bit sweet and malty.Easy drinkable macro lager beer.
Well, very famous, and really medium quality... I don’t think it deserves the fame.
One of the better tasting pale lager beers with a pleasant bitterness and refreshing acidity.

Die Schaumkrone schäumt gut auf und hält mittelmäig. Es schmeckt hopfig, mild und macht einen hohlen Eindruck, ja es täuscht etwas an und dann fehlt da irgendwie etwas, das gefällt mir nicht gut. Auch schmeckt es leicht malzig-zuckrig. 
	
Test vom 26.9.2009, Gebinde: Dose 	Noten: 10,7,6,7,5,6 - 6,65

On tap.
Pours a clear golden colour with a strong size head and lots of carbonation.

On tap. Malty aromas. Pours bright gold, with nice creamy white head (thys may be due to the tap itself, cause i´ve not seen this in bottle versions), some persistent and lacing. Light body, watered down, oily texture and average carbonation. Taste is more sweet than bitter. Nothing remarkable.
golden with minimal head. slight grassy aroma. decent euro lager. crisp with a pleasant bite to the carbonation.

Bottle. Aroma has notes of skunk piss, wheat malts and fruity hops.  Pale gold hue with a small white head that mostly diminished and left ok lace.  Flavor is lightly sweet and bitter.  Palate is light bodied and watery soft.  Overall I could see this being drinkable when fresh on tap but this bottle was a little skunked.
Grain and wet grass aroma. Deep straw that is clear with low white head. Taste is harsh, some metal and chewy wet grass. Thin mouthfeel drops off quickly with a harsh bite in mid-palate.

On tap at Fingers. Pours pale gold with plenty of fizz and a thin head. The nose is lightly malty and a little metallic. The taste is more of the same and you can see why this is served very gold. Light bodied clean but unpleasant finish. Overall, why us this everywhere.
330ml bottle. Very beautiful golden color. Small white head. Aroma is hops, sweet. Light body, but surprisingly deep. Bread, malt and bit of hops.

Pours clear straw yellow with one finger of white head.  Green glass = skunked nose, very skunky and metallic with a light sweetness and herbal character with wet paper and flabby mouthfeel.  Soft bready notes.

Originally rated August 2004. Sampled from a 500ml can. Poured a light golden colour with a thick creamy-bubbly head leaving a nice foamy lacing. Great retention. Lightly carbonated and had a mild grassy hop nose. Crisp and smooth. Very mild hop taste shaped a weak mouthfeel. Actually, almost tastes nothing. Good thing for the beautiful appearance (head). Other then that, a great beer for those who hate the taste of beer.
Smell of maize and sugar. Pale golden colour. Small head. Aroma of maize and plastic.

Bottle @ home. I found this baby in the back of my parent’s fridge- grazie dad! Pours a clear, golden appearance with a white head and moderate lacing. Light honey, fairly sweet, straw, hay, pale malty aroma. Interesting enough, there is a touch of wheat in the flavor that adds a bit of sweet fruitiness (very slight but present), pretty sweet malty flavor with straw and grass and only a moderate amount of bitterness. Carbonation is pretty high and quite fizzy. Overall, not a bad pale lager, but hop extract? Really? If you’re going to do that shit, there’s no reason to advertise it.

In the category of pale lagers made with corn and other ingredients that don’t belong in beer this is one of the better ones but that is faint praise. Bland and watery but identifiable as beer and not unpleasant.

Bottle poured into pint glass. Near perfect golden color; very traditional pale lager aroma- reminds me of walking around a beer festival. Smooth light crispness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clean, crisp, and a perfect European tasting pale lager.  I was pleasantly surprised I’ve been avoiding ordering this beer for quite some time and it didn’t let me down.  Crisp finish with an excellent mild flavor to it.  Recommended.
Nice straw/gold color; Light body; Aroma of light malt, & grain; Flavor of slight sweet malt, hops, and some citrus; Not that bland but the body is watery; Average at best.
Nice but average pale lager.  Amber poor, slight head that laces the glass. Thirst quenching and easily drinkable but nothing to exciting.  Good base session beer.
In bottle, brewed (under licence) in Australia. Golden colour, thin white head. Dry taste with low bitterness.

275ml bottle   pale gold with big white head  . no detectable aroma . medium carbonation . taste is grainy and cardboard with a dry light bitter finish .  astringent aftertaste . a typical commercial lager
Pours a pale golden colour with little head.  Is quite soft with a little bitterness on the back palate.
earthy, grass, roasty, cooked vegetables, pale, hazy, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, fizzy,

Appearance  was golden with diminishing 1 finger whiteish creamy head, lacing throughout drink. Aromas where sweet honey and caramel malts, hops where sublte citrusy and pine, yeasts was floral. Taste was sweet honey malts and slight mix of lemony hops. Palate was smooth and light carbonation with light body thats easy to drink. Average dryish caulky finish. Light easy drinker, yet with slight metallic touch...
Somewhat bland but drinkable light lager. Light hoppiness. Pours a pale gold and has a small head.

Sam Bost Lager glass from bottle. A: pretty fragrant for a later, consisted of hay and alcohol. App: nice clear, amberish gold. Quickly settling thin white head. T: very malty, fairly crisp, tastes of alcohol and some bitter hops. P: mostly smooth with crisp bubbles that fade quickly, but hop bitterness that holds through at the end for a rather lengthy after taste.
Light hoppy aroma. Small, frothy, white head. Fair lacing. Clear, yellow body. Light bitter flavor. Light to medium palate.

Brewed under license in Australia, so perhaps not the genuine article. Poured a decent amber with a white head. Not much on the nose. The taste is largely driven by malt with a bit of hop overlay. Refreshing and crisp, but not great.

Pours  a straw yellow with a tight thick head.  With a little coaxing the head hangs around, but very diminished.  Sweet malt with a hint of bitterness, not much aroma to speak of.  The body is somewhere between light and medium.  This seems like a beer that would rather go to Germany than Italy, but it comes up somewhat wanting.

Pours a clear golden color with a medium frothy white head with good retention. Aroma of noble grassy hops and bready malts. Slightly more complex than the regular pale lager but nothing to write home about it. Taste is slightly bitter, somewhat watery and bready. Good, crisp and clean but lacks personality. This one reminds me of Grolsch and Stella Artois only breadier. Light bodied and refreshing. A good pale lager for the hot and humid summer days of Rapa Nui.
Oh dear Oh dear Oh dear Oh dear Oh dear what a great year for music 1664 was i must say sadly it was a very bad year for beed indeedly.

A decent major brand lager.  I would take it over Bud, Miller,etc, and I actually like it more than Heineken, a much bigger seller of an import. If you are in a French Caribbean island, this is about as good as it gets, unfortunately.
Bottle. Pours light golden with a nice lager head. Aroma butter, some hops. A feel of barley when it hits the mouth. Thin palate.
11.2 oz bottle. Smells like what the guy next door to me in college used to smoke. No head. Pale straw color. Bitter, skunky taste that finishes clean. The Natty Light of France.

Nice 3 finger head that caps overe the glass like a crown. I have the 5% imported can version. Smells like a sweat eroupe lager smell. It’s heavy bodied from the hops and is a syrupy citrus taste with a brief after taste of spice and citrus. Like what there wheat beer probably taste like. I can taste a little wheat beer after taste is all. heavy bodied lager. Looks really refreashing.

Im Glas kommts goldgelb daher, die mittelporige Krone hält sich nicht besonders lange. Geruchlich harmonieren würzige und hopfige Töne gut miteinander. Vom Geschmack her ist das Bier ziemlich herb, im Nachgeschmack wird’s sehr getreidig und etwas torfig. Das 1664 würd ich jetzt nicht als schlecht bezeichnen, aber da gibt’s in Frankreich bessere Biere…
Bottle, good white head, round taste with nice hop taste, got this one for the first time in france

Bottle (4,7%). Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of sweet malt with a hint of hops. A bit sweet and fruity with a just slightly bitter finish. OK from bottle, and not so bad fresh from tap late at night.
Probably slighty better than the regular Kronenbourg. But not enough to explain the price. To avoid...

For me this is one of the best premium larger available in the UK compared to the other verities we have on our super market shelf or draught at the pub.
It has a grassy / hoppy aroma which lack in other locally available beers, the best quality of this beer is that it has a lengthy after taste and is therefore much more satisfying to drink even after the first sip. Highly recommend on a hot summers day and very refreshing. 

Recommended draught.

Draft at a student union bar in London. Last ’new’ beer of my England trip, ouch. Drivel: weak, sour and too flavorful in the wrong ways. pale and a bit offensive. Glad this hasn’t invaded Belgrade, worse than the local macro lagers.

Bottle.  Pours pale yellow, clear, with a small white head.  Smell is pretty minimal but there is some bread in there.  Taste is light, crisp, and very drinkable.  I went into this will very low expectations but this is a solid lager from France.  I’d drink this again.
Bottle. Clear light golden colour with a minimal head. Aroma is hay and malt. Weak taste.
Malty taste along with some alcohol notes. Very watery but it’s farmhouse/ funky taste masks that.....

50cl bottle, 1.20€. Clear yellow, small fine white head. Nose is fresh but skunky. Aroma mostly of grains with sweet malts anda little honey. Mostly sweet with a faint hoppy bitterness in the finish. Fresh, soft carbonation, light body, session stuff.

On tap. Clear gold, high carbonation. Aroma is grassy, similar corn odour you get from generic mass produced products. Flavour was a touch fruity (apple, pear). Slight overtone of straw. Mostly still that sweet malt/corn. Not terrible, all things considered. Still - their slogan is "la premiÃ¨re biÃ¨re francaise". Je ne pense pas. Drink it quick and cold.

33cl bottle. Pours pale yellow with a big white head. Smells a little fruity. Tastes fruity, abit peaches, slight bitter with a similar finish.

Aroma/ligth, Appearance Head/Initial-frothy, Head/Color light, Body/Hue-black, Initial Flavor-acidic light. Finish Flavor-acidic light Palate/Body-medium to full, ok beer
It’s as generic as can be chums. Lager at its worse. No aroma, no hop flavour, no flavour too be honest. Boo hiss, this is bad.

not that bad for a pale lager.
slight grassy hop flavour which balances the slight bitterness.
quaffable in a hot kitchen!

A - wheat and grass
A - clear with a thick head
T - light sweet with crisp dry bitter
P - thin to mid and dry
O - decent

A lager with not much taste and aroma in it, but this one is actually quite refreshing. Pours pale, a tiny bit of white foam. Could see me buying this again if I want a refreshing beer on a hot summer day, but is doesn’t stand that much out in the crowd of macro brews...
Pours straw gold. Aroma of grain and European yeast. Taste is sweet malt with a touch of warm maltiness. Decent carbonation with a clean aftertaste.
Headbanging lager, although a bit better than average in the popular beers stakes.

50 cl. can. Clear, golden colour with a medium sized head, that faded quickly. Hay, grass and a grainy note in the aroma. Light bitter taste with a little bit of hops. Light to medium body with a lively carbonation, that fits this type of beer good. Short, dry finish. Better than excepted and it went okay with a pizza and salad.

So, this is the deal: we brew a beer using  processed ingredients like maize, wheat malt, colour:caramel, hop extract, and at the end we’ll put in aromatic hops from Alsace. What is wrong with these people? I’m sick of being told that things are the most popular or the biggest seller as if it’s a recommendation. Not a bad beer but why not try and make a really good one that people will buy and drink because its different and delicious and not just familiar and easy to find. Perhaps this "left over from a party" schtick has REALLY come to an end!

Corn isn’t listed as an ingredient, but this has the odor and taste of corn, malt, carbonation, and hops.  The overall effect is of a slightly "turned" (skunky) beer, but, this being my first, I can’t speak about freshness.  I cna drink it, but why?

Golden colour with a think light lasting head. Faint hoppy, corn and lime smell that seems strange at first. Medium thin body with light carbonation. Feels a bit rough in the mouth. It has an appealing dry sweet malt taste but the center has a bit of a cardboard feel and a watery sweet citrus finish. Its drinkable but average.
275ml bottle.  Pours gold with a large head.  Aroma is corn with some light malt.  Taste  is mostly corn.  Poor.  Watery finish.
Crisp, and refreshing with some bread notes and a tad bit of flowery hops somewhere in there. Easy drinker, but not much else.

Pours pale amber with a clear head, flowery aroma, and very high carbonation. for a lager, this has quite a flowery fruity taste, but its not particularly interesting, and there is a lot of fizz. its refreshing enough served cold, but not particularly great.

Yellow, with a big, white fizzy head.
Plenty of carbonation.
Should be served ice cold.
330mL bottle poured a straw color into glass with small white head and little lacing.  Aromas is grassy hops and grainy malt.  Taste is slightly skunky bitterness with a light grainy sweetness.
Can 33cl. Pale yellow with white head. Aroma and taste to malt and hops. Medium carbonation and bodied. Boring beer.
Keg everywhere. It’s a lager, isn’t it... Yellow, fizzy, cleaner than some, but no real flavour to speak of.

Közepesen sötét, nap sárga szín, közepes méretű, fehér, nagy buborékos és könnyen illanó habbal. Illata vizes, enyhén malátás és kukoricás. Ízében is a kukorica dominál, némi maláta és komló támogatással. Könnyű teste van és közepesen buborékos. Utóíze enyhén fanyar és kissé száraz. Egy egyszerű core lager, minden jellemzőjével, modern ruhában...

Bottle.  Pours a straw yellow with decent lacing.  Smell is wheat and some hops with some citrus and also some sweetness.  Taste was better than I would have thought.  Refreshing, crisp, a good hop bite.  In the top tier of pale lagers for whatever that is worth.

Date: September 24, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Minneapolis Beer Fest.  Full description not available as I sampled way too many beers in 4.5 hours!

March 30, 2017 - on tap in Paris. Clear golden pour with nice head and lacing. Aroma was sweet malt and grain. Taste was consistent with the aroma. Previously had this at 1.8, but this was much better here, so moved up to a 3.0.

This being my first French brew to sample, I didn’t have any set expectations.  Not a bad brew at all I must say, but nothing outstanding either.  If you like Heineken then you’ll easily like this brew as well.  It pours a rich copper-colored body sporting a somewhat dismal bubbly head that dissipates very quickly and leaves very little lacing. Upon opening, my senses detected a very grassy, somewhat pungent, odor that frankly nearly kept me from sampling this brew.  It’s a bitter tasting beer; for me it was almost too bitter (but that’s just me).  Flavors detected consisted of the traditional grains, malts and hops; but I just could not find a happy balance between them; but the grassy flavor was very appearant and somewhat overbearing.  It’s very light on the pallet and a brew that can be a good session beer; especially on those hot summer days.

0,5l can, TESCO. As i saw, its alcohol content is 5%. Average yellow colour, silky CO2, but stabile foam describes. Aroma is grain and wheat malt, so sweetness and citrus dominate. Body is light, hop can feel only in a few gulp. Not bad but pricy.

Light blond and very see through, white head with high carbonation. Aroma slightly floral and a bit boozy, possibly chemical smell. Doesn’t really taste of much. One of my preferred mainstream lagers, but that doesn’t say much, and a few pints of this will give you a stinking hangover in the morning.
Standard pilsner looks, standard pilsner aroma and standard pilsner taste. Had side to side with a Heineken and it was virtually indistinguishable. (33cl bottle)

Clear golden pour thin soapy white head with sticky lacing .... aroma of corn, sweet malts and some floral hop .... taste is of corn, sweet malts and some floral spicy hops ... flavors are all subtle and the mouthfeel is a bit thin and watery with just a little funk .... all in all not bad lawnmower beer
Golden colour, small bubbly head. Grain, malt, bread aroma. Taste is sweet, slight skunk. Probably could have copied my review for any number of mass Euro lagers.

Bottle. Pours golden, medium white head, good amount of carbonation bubbles. Aroma of basement aromas and grass, quite mild. Light sweetness to it, flavor not as watered-down as I expected. Thin body, crisp tingly finish. Overall not bad for the style.
Draft. Pours pale golden yellow, medium foamy head dissipates quickly. Nose is grainy malt, touch of dry grass and corn. Crispness and dry finish.

11.2 fl oz bottle, as part of a mixed six-pack from my Uncle. I saw this many times while I was in Paris, but never got a chance to try it, so this a fortunate gift. Clear golden yellow color, minimal white head on the surface, minimal lacing. Good, strong carbonation, but it doesn’t come off as too thick. Somewhat hearty, pleasant aftertaste (for a pale lager). Definitely umami. Usual, boring, yeasty pale lager aroma all throughout, however.
Bottle. A generic pale lager from France. Skunky and clear. Not very good at all.
Golden yellow beer with nice head.Grassy smell,light straw.Taste light bitter,light sweet malts,apple.

Bought this in nearest alcohol shop because was to lazy go to the normal store and get some decent beer.  After 2 cans decided to get some decent beer and throw that away....

Feels like concentrate divided with water

Some smell and basically no taste , hops only for aroma.  Commercial beer  and nothing more. From that beer you can  only get a hangover for a next day. This is a chemical drink not a beer.

People,  do not buy this and others concentrated beers  it is poison for your body !

Bottle in a weizen glass. Pours dark yellow with lots of white foam. Aroma is bread and corn. Taste is everso slightly bitter. I have to admit that this was the first beer I ever got drunk on. Easy to drink though has a hint of smoky aftertaste. Overall an ok beer.
Refrigerated green bottle poured into a shaker.  Some lacing, low carbonation, and watery texture.  Taste is light malt, a little corn, and a hint of skunk.

Skunky and white bread in the aroma while the appearance is generic golden pale lager, although very slightly darker than usual.  The flavor is grassy and  bready.  Although not bad, the green bottle made this very skunky and I’m guessing it was far from the greatest lager to begin with.
Very light, not really to my taste. Nothing very special in this beer at all.

Geruch unspektakulär herb. Geschmacklich wässrig-lasch mit leichten Hopfenspuren durchsetzt. 
Kronenbourg 1664 war keine tolle Erfahrung.Test vom 2.10.2007, Gebinde: Dose

pours golden yellow, minimal lacing, small bubbles but medium carbonated. Initial sip, THIS IS LIGHT, way too light for my liking. Looking at the ingredients: glucose syrup = suspicious.., hop extract = mmmkay... Not looking good. Extremely light and thin, watery, mild flavours of wheat and barley that just fizzles with the airy carbonation. Definitely not a stand-alone beer; need it with a meal. Low depth, light body, low complexity, short length.
500ml can. Easy drinking pale euro-lager. Decent enough, but nothing interesting.

Was really surprised to see how low of a rating this beer has been getting. I assume its because people dislike French lol. Anyway, i think its quite amazing. It has one of the best heads. Not only is it thick and foamy, but it lasts. It has full bodied taste and really pleasant after taste. Does not linger, therefore allowing you to take another gulp right away.
Nothing special, just another regular pilsener. Nice yellow/golden color, average smell, decent taste and a low to medium body.
Maltier than many draught lagers sold in UK but still watery, headless and unexciting. Quenches thirst but so does plain water...

Can, so no skunk in my sample. Golden with quite quickly dissipating head, despite the wheat malt used. Faint yet pleasant malty aroma with some apples. Taste is malty, some apples, also soapy elements, metallic ones and a bit of alcohol. Additionally quite high carbonation. In spite of all that it is not an unpleasant beer, especially for a macro lager.
Ja, inte gick man i spinn över den här precis. En högst ordinär, om inte till och med tråkig, lager.
not a gd beer nothing good about it would not buy or drink it again poor quilty beer
Golden color, light weak hoppy aroma and taste, light watery body, watery finish.

Gold color, small duration on the foam, highly carbonated.
Normal lager aromas.
Tastes kinda watery with a flat palate feeling.
Typical lager with no character.

On draft at Zeehelden fesitival, the Hague. 
Another run of the mill pils.  Not very exciting
Tap. Straw yellow pour with a white head. Carbonated. Just your run of the mill pils. Not good but there are worse.
On draft at Zeehelden fesitival.  Just another pilsner, certainly not the worst I’ve tried..
